section.title: Graceful failover
section.p: By default, graceful failover is implemented with failing over a node from a cluster using couchbase-cli failover
To failover the node from the cluster immediately use the --force option. If this option is not specified, graceful failover is implemented (default).
To re-add a server node to a cluster, use the couchbase-cli tool and the recovery command with the --recovery-type parameter. Recovery options are either full or delta.

To set a failover, readd, recovery and rebalance sequence operations:
section.codeblock:
couchbase-cli failover -c 192.168.0.1:8091 \\ --server-failover=192.168.0.2 \\ -u Administrator -p password
couchbase-cli server-readd -c 192.168.0.1:8091 \\ --server-add=192.168.0.2 \\ -u Administrator -p password
couchbase-cli recovery -c 192.168.0.1:8091 \\ --server-recovery=192.168.0.2 \\ --recovery-type=delta \\ -u Administrator -p password
couchbase-cli rebalance -c 192.168.0.1:8091 \\ -u Administrator -p password
section.note: Be sure to update any scripts that implement failover.
